content.description: 10a (r) -- on excellent rock.  V. good route for those comfortable in the grade.  Cruxes in first third of route.
content.location: Just right of the excellent looking and nice climbing Mile High Crack.

content.description:
4-bolt variation to "Shell of a Man".

Start just up-hill and left of "Shell of A Man" on an obvious arete, or climb straight up. Move right past the second bolt through a tricky sequence, then finish up on easier terrain.
content.location: Down-hill from Pink Face and left of Shell of A Man

content.description: Some initial strength is required for opening sequences, easier terrain follows.
content.location: Just below and right of the Pink Face, second route to the right of the arete.

content.description: Fun, easy face climbing past 3 bolts leads to a short steep headwall. Clip 2 more bolts past big jugs to the anchors.
content.location: Just downhill and right of Pink Face. North facing wall. Start on obvious platform below first bolt.

content.description: Start can be awkward and first bolt is a bit high. Short route with sufficient crimpers and footholds. Worth a quick run if in the area.
content.location: Bolted line left of the crack bisecting the face.

content.description:
Climb an initial tricky slab to a steeper blocky face, then continue past a couple easy ledges to gain the short but stellar arete.

Crux moves are on the upper section of the arete.
content.location: Far right side of the Pink Face Buttress.  Start just right and uphill of Muppet Show on the obvious platform.

content.description:
Not one that gets lead very often I am guessing. Shares an anchor with

Rapscallion

and can be top roped off it's anchor. Kinda funny this thing has 2 bolts. more or less directionals for a tr. But if you bring a rack down this one is worth leading, did you bring extra fist size gear?
content.protection: Mostly big, fist size and 2 bolts.

content.location: Just to the right of "Shell of A Man"

content.description: Clip the first bolt, then move up and left through the crux of the route - about 15' of tricky moves. Continue up and right after surmounting the difficulties on fun holds to the anchors.
content.location: Just uphill of Naked Gun on the right side of the front-side buttress.

content.description: Looks good, climbs fun. Restful positions for gear placements if someone's looking for practice.
content.location: Obvious hand-sized crack right of the gully on Pink Face.

content.description:
From the big ledge that shares the start of "Wowie Zowie": Either climb straight up (avoiding the ledge to the right) for the 5.10 bit past the first three bolts, or scramble up and right through clean ledges and clip the third bolt for the 5.9 variation.

Either way, climb past steep edges and pockets on great rock, then finish with a balancy exit.
content.location: Far right side of Pink Face - scramble up an easy groove to gain the start.

content.description: Chimney/double crack, traverse right to anchor of Wowie Zowie (mussy hooks

A very easy but surprisingly fun climb on great quality rock.

Climb a slabby face with ledges and shallow eyebrows to a short, steep face followed by easy pockets to the anchor.

Long draws recommended for the anchor to reduce rope drag if you are TRing.
content.location: Located on the separate river-side formation left and downhill from Natural Lite.  Make an immediate left off the river crossing.
